selectedVerses.text: But when they had stretched him out for the whips, Paul said to the centurion who was standing by, "Is it lawful for you to flog a man who is a Roman citizen and uncondemned?"
This man was seized by the Jews and was about to be killed by them when I came upon them with the soldiers and rescued him, having learned that he was a Roman citizen.

But Paul said to them, "They have beaten us publicly, uncondemned, men who are Roman citizens, and have thrown us into prison; and do they now throw us out secretly? No! Let them come themselves and take us out."
So the tribune came and said to him, "Tell me, are you a Roman citizen?" And he said, "Yes."
and from there to Philippi, which is a leading city of the district of Macedonia and a Roman colony. We remained in this city some days.
